Author: Yuval Noah Harari
Description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species.
Title: SAPIENS

Author: David Grann
Description: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil. The fledgling F.B.I. intervened, ineffectively.
Title: KILLERS OF THE FLOWER MOON

Author: John Grisham
Description: Grisham's first nonfiction book concerns a man wrongly sentenced to death.
Title: THE INNOCENT MAN

Author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg with Mary Hartnett and Wendy W Williams
Description: A collection of articles and speeches by the Supreme Court justice.
Title: MY OWN WORDS

Author: Phil Knight
Description: A memoir by the co-founder of Nike, Inc.
Title: SHOE DOG

Author: Ron Chernow
Description: A biography of the first Treasury secretary and one of the Founding Fathers of the United States. Originally published in 2004 and the basis of the Tony Award-winning Broadway musical.
Title: ALEXANDER HAMILTON

Author: Brian Kilmeade and Don Yaeger
Description: Major General Jackson takes on the British in Louisiana.
Title: ANDREW JACKSON AND THE MIRACLE OF NEW ORLEANS

Author: Bryan Stevenson
Description: A law professor and MacArthur grant recipient’s memoir of his decades of work to free innocent people condemned to death.
Title: JUST MERCY

Author: Daniel Kahneman
Description: When we can and cannot trust our intuitions in making business and personal decisions.
Title: THINKING, FAST AND SLOW

Author: Angela Duckworth
Description: The MacArthur Fellow argues that passion and perseverance are more important than innate talent in creating success.
Title: GRIT

Author: Robin DiAngelo
Description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people and how this inhibits cross-racial dialogue.
Title: WHITE FRAGILITY

Author: Bessel van der Kolk
Description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
Title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

Author: Erik Larson
Description: A story of how an architect and a serial killer were linked by the Chicago World's Fair of 1893. Originally published in 2003.
Title: THE DEVIL IN THE WHITE CITY

Author: Yuval Noah Harari
Description: A provocative look into the future by the author of “Sapiens.”
Title: HOMO DEUS

Author: David Sheff
Description: A father struggles with his son's meth addiction.
Title: BEAUTIFUL BOY
